ratings.comment: Patronizing and boring. So glad he's moved on to teach in China

Easiest section of the class, less memorizing than bio/archaeological. You need to read the classical readings text, but not the other book. The material is all on the slides so it's easy to understand what you need to know. He is a friendly professor, and when I walked out of the final exam he even asked me how it went!
Lectures were confusing and all over the place, he is super kind and funny but exams were tough because it was hard to know what we needed to know

Talks fast and is hard to understand. All the info is on the slides so understanding him isn't that big of a deal. Boring class but he tries to make it fun and get people to participate. Super nice guy.

The most boring really.  I don't know if it was Prof. Zhou or the curriculum for anthro 104, but it really was a snooze-fest.  The only plus side was that it covered ethnic & international studies.  Also, it was only two regular lectures and a discussion for 3 credits, so there wasn't a whole lot of in-class time.

I recommend not taking this class for ethnic studies. I did all the readings and still did bad in the class. The exams are based on the readings and not on lecture, so it's pointless to go. This class is definitely too hard only for a gen ed course.
This Professor need to work on his grammar on slides. Almost all of the tests come from the readings and lectures are completly pointless.

I like most people took this class for ethnic studies. It is not too difficult, tests are fair, as long as you have done all of the readings, his lectures are hit and miss but overall its not too bad of a class. The fieldwork project isnt very fun but very manageable. Lots of reading.

Lecture was decent, exam was okay, readings in the Classical Readings of Anthro were actually interesting and helpful (KNOW them for the exam), but I NEVER used the other textbook we were required to buy. Threw some humor in his class and was worth listening to. There were times when I had no idea what some of the topics were.
Entertaining lecturer and helpful when you have questions...overall liked him as a professor a lot!

This class is really easy if you just keep up with reading. Lectures are pointless and low priority on the 2 exams. Every week 1 out of the 2 lectures is a movie that brings boredom to a new level. Read the textbook and classic readings becuase they make up a huge part of the test and the class is cake.

The class is stupid and pointless but incredibly easy. Full of guest lecturers and movies but never entertaining. Very little homework is given and discussions are hell to sit through but it does fill ethnic studies.

Lectures are pretty simplistic, but this year we had too many guest lecturers. Not only that but discussion was just random talks about what people thought about the lecture, not what the lecture was about (how does that help us with tests?). There are two tests, a fieldwork exercise, and discussion participation.

What a useless class. Lectures are unbelievably boring. Lots of reading which always shows up on the tests. The lectures have low priorities on tests. Discussion sections are painful to sit through. I have come out of this class as knowledgable in anthropology as I was before taking the class.

Even though I got an A, I left this course feeling like I learned nothing at all. All of the things in the Cultural section you should have figured out purely from life experience. If you have an intelligent sense of humor, his jokes will seem extremely patronizing and (yes) ethnocentric. Worst professor of all three. I hate him.

Of 3 prof, he was definitely best. Kind of funny-sometimes a little hard to understand. KNOW classic tales and their connections to other lectures and KNOW bold terms from book and KNOW ALL of your lecture notes. Easiest test of three. I would only recommend this sect of this class-the other 2 suck.
Kinda funny in class. Test is easy even though you have two textbooks. Focus on the authors of each story and their subjects
Awesome guy, so cute. Very easy tests, puts everything he says on the overhead. Recommended for sure, interesting material.

This class would be fine except the teacher is a Marxist who uses specific English words in the wrong contexts because he thinks they sound sophisticated. His notes make absolutely no sense and he's very patronizing.

He definitely has a good sense of humour and wide base of knowledge. I really enjoy listening to his lectures, and as others have said, his accent is not detrimental. The two textbooks used for the Cultural section (Zhou's portion of the course) are very interesting collections of writings/essays and research articles.

he has a good sense of humor and made listening to lectures easy, despite his accent, which actually wasnt that bad. read the text book alot, but was helpful in the long run. he really cares about what he teaches.

Had a class with him freshman and junior year. He's easy but the material/books are interesting. Though he often only brushed upon the surface of what could be more indepth/interesting material. One time I think he questioned our true intelligence when he said we only had to read part of a book b/c the second half was too hard...that was a first.
He gave a midterm and no final and wondered why students stopped showing up.
He gave a midterm and no final and wondered why students stopped showing up.
zhou has a clever and charming sense of humor. also, he's outrageously easy. the accent is not a problem at all--at least in my 70 person lecture. oh, and he is very helpful during office hours.
Kind of boring, but you'll definitely do well if you just go to lecture and do the readings.  I didn't do much of either and I still got a B.

Zhou is an outstanding professor.  his classes are easy A's, he is very helpful [if you have a small class with him] and he knows his stuff.  it is true that he can be a little hard to understand sometimes b/c of speaking, but he'll be more than willing to explain "it" to you if you just ask.  great guy.  great classes. known to crack jokes.
a fun class
Thick accent, but a nice man.  Helpful; checks his e-mail often.  Very easy class.

le. le. le professor was ok. I couldn't understand what he said so I spaced out and/or never went to class. Still got an A. I found the class had no underlying theme or structure. pretty blah but easy A.
No Comments

Zhou is a great professor! He really knows his stuff, and enjoys teaching it. I don't know why people complain about his speech, everything he says is on the overhead. Maybe you just can't read? If anything it's entertaining. Give him a break. It's great to have a non-american perspective on things.

Easy class.  Thick accent, but he really loves what he teaches and tries really hard.  Throws weird jokes in there to liven things a bit, see if you can catch them through his accent.  Video every week.  I stopped going to lecture after the first two weeks, so I can't say much more.
Not only is it hard to understand his english but his lectures are very poorly structured.  The class is easy and the movies are somewhat entertaining.
nice guy

He seems genuinely interested in the subject, he is fairly straightforward, and somewhat interesting. don't like how two tests are worth so much. yeah he has an accent, but you forget it after a while and he has good grammar.  I think the movies are interesting...
very easy but somewhat boring class. tests are easy if you do the readings and memorize the key terms.
Sometimes hard to understand, but the readings are fairly interesing.  Lots of movies during class.  Lectures can be boring because he just reads from his slides, but the tests aren't too bad.
Cant beat the lame videos that we watch every lecture.  The course content is great but he does need some help explaining it to us...plus i dont like how reads everything right from his projector.

give the guy a chance manz! sure, his english is bad and he wears his favorite green shirt every lecture, but the guy tries hard. could improve on his speech though. can't understand why anthropology became 'anthropol-age' and 'after' became 'aft' and 'the' became 'le'.

he is extremely hard to understand, tests are easy but multiple choice, and some of the answers are somewhat debatable.  content isn't hard but you better hope for a good TA.  he is a smart guy but can't pronounce anything

Yeah so he's foreign... but he is very understanding and the accent is entertaining.  I think he really does care about the topic he discusses and I think the class is worth having to try a little harder to listen... and he talks slow so it isnt that bad.
Two lectures of week and one of which a video.  Interesting subject matter in discussion section, though. Really easy.
I didn't like how he bashed America and Democracy all the time. I don't know how much I really learned from him.... but the class isn't that hard.

Ok, yes the class was easy, but come on the guy can't speak english! Can I just comment on the "le le le le..." factor? He can't say "The" he says "le", and he stutters. Oh man, SO glad my days in that class are over!
This was a very easy class.  Usually, he would lecture us one day, and then have a video the following lecture.  Very entertaining class, even though he's hard to understand at times.
Easy class... sometimes he's hard to understand, but he's entertaining.
